definition: to prick/to run or stick (a needle etc) into/jug (a classifier for liquids such as beer)
to tie/to bind/classifier for flowers, banknotes etc: bundle/Taiwan pr. [zha2]
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex

sentences.english: And yet the movement is a masterpiece of pattern designing all the time.
sentences.chinese: 莫扎特的这一乐章又自始至终是乐式设计的杰作。

sentences.english: This recording of the Mozart violin concertos is quite simply the best available.
sentences.chinese: 这是莫扎特的小提琴协奏曲录制简直可以说是最好的。

sentences.english: I love Mozart's melody; I love Markov Process.
sentences.chinese: 吾爱莫扎特之韵律，吾亦爱马尔可夫过程。

sentences.english: If it is that easy, why were there so few Mozarts in the world?
sentences.chinese: 如果这么容易，为什么世上难得有几个莫扎特呢？

sentences.english: I love Mozart 's melo zdy; I love Markov Process.
sentences.chinese: 吾爱莫扎特之韵律，吾亦爱马尔可夫过程。
在莫扎特的歌剧《唐乔凡尼》中。

sentences.english: Mozart showed genius even at the age of six, when he began to compose minutes.
sentences.chinese: 莫扎特六岁时开始创作小步舞曲，展露才华。

sentences.english: He is a violoncellist in a symphony orchestra.
sentences.chinese: 乐队演奏了一首莫扎特的交响曲。

sentences.english: How could this contribute to our understanding of the Mozart effect on premature babies?
sentences.chinese: 这将如何增进我们对早产儿的莫扎特效应的理解的呢？

sentences.english: In 1787 Beethoven traveled to Vienna and met his idol, Mozart.
sentences.chinese: 纳，见到了他崇拜的偶象莫扎特。

sentences.english: Some of Mozart and Beethoven's early works, Chopin, Liszt.
sentences.chinese: 莫扎特和贝多芬的早期作品，肖邦，李斯特。

sentences.english: The name of Mozart is forever coupled with the city of Salzburg.
sentences.chinese: 莫扎特的名字永远与萨尔茨堡城联系在一起。

sentences.english: Pictures of Mozart and Beethoven hang on the walls.
sentences.chinese: 墙壁上挂着莫扎特和贝多芬的画像。

sentences.english: Mozart is dead but his music lives on .
sentences.chinese: 莫扎特死了，但他的音乐流芳百世。

sentences.english: No. 6: Dies Irae from Mozart’s Requiem
sentences.chinese: 第六:《安魂曲》，出自莫扎特的《安灵曲》。

sentences.english: On January 27th, 1756, composer Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart was born in Salzburg, Austria.
sentences.chinese: 1756年，作曲家莫扎特于奥地利萨斯堡出生。

definition: Frederic Chopin or Fryderyk Franciszek Chopin (1810-1849), Polish pianist and composer
Handel (name)/George Frideric Handel (1685-1759), German-born Baroque composer, naturalized British in 1727
Antonin Dvořák (1841-1904), Bohemian composer, author of nine symphonies including the New World symphony
Hector Berlioz (1803-1869), French romantic composer, author of Symphonie Fantastique
Niccolò Paganini (1782-1840), Italian violinist and composer
Piotr Ilyich Tchaikowsky (1840-1893), Russian composer, composer of 6 symphonies and the opera Eugene Onegin
Alexander Scriabin (1872-1915), Russian composer and pianist
Strauss (name)/Johann Strauss (1825-1899), Austrian composer/Richard Strauss (1864-1949), German composer
Modest Mussorgsky (1839-1881), Russian composer, composer of Pictures at an Exhibition
